column4: Can any one tell me how to gey my apache to serve from boot and still allow multi user account on ubuntu?
*get
what do you mean by "still allow multi user account on ubuntu"?
umm, how are you running apache?
please don't be vague.  Did you install apache through the repositories?
websites onle seem to work if I log into my account?  What does that mean?  What exactly doesn't work?  Where are the files being stored exactly?  Is your home encrypted?
If I log into the account I set them up in I can restart my apache and they are live. but once someone else logs into their account they stop working
and the other questions I asked?
/var/www
and I don't know what "set them up in" means
my home is default settings, I don't know if that is encrypted
the login I used to access ubuntu
what does "set them up in" mean?
are you trying to be unhelpful
I am just trying to get some sites woring in apache in a multi user environment, surely this is not the first time it's been done

no, I am asking questions so I can actually understand what is happening.  I am not there with you.  The questions I ask are because you are saying things that are clear to you, but I am not standing next to you. Avoid using ambiguous pronouns
yes, apache is usually completely unrelated to your user logging in.  My only guess was that you had files in your home and it was encrypted.  You've ruled that out however.  Thus my other questions.
you need to determine if your home is encrypted
(I'm not sure how offhand)
should it be
it's a choice at install
I don't believe it is, sorry for being short I have pnumonia at the moment and it's made me crabby, laters
